meanings.definition: The quality or state of being treatable.
meanings.sent1: The treatability of the disease gave hope to the patient.
meanings.sent2: The doctor assessed the treatability of the injury before proceeding with the treatment plan.
meanings.sent3: The treatability of the puzzle made it enjoyable to solve.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude increased the treatability of the situation.
meanings.sent5: The treatability of the problem was evident after the new medication was introduced.

meanings.definition: The capacity to respond to treatment.
meanings.sent1: The treatability of the patient was remarkable, showing quick improvement.
meanings.sent2: The treatability of the virus was a key factor in choosing the appropriate medication.
meanings.sent3: The treatability of the plant to sunlight made it thrive in the garden.
meanings.sent4: His treatability to feedback helped him grow professionally.
meanings.sent5: The treatability of the stain with the cleaning solution was impressive.
